Posts.Content: KSK wrote: Hi & back again so soon... I had a large (infected) (apparently) breast cyst aspirated 2 days ago, is it usual for them to refill so quickly? If it is, I guess I’ll have to live with it but it’s a large hard lump (as always was) so quite uncomfortable in my small breasts... Any cyst advice hugely appreciated! Thanks. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast Cyst Refilled within 48 Hours - Normal? KSK Erinashley19

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2017 02:16PM KSK wrote: Hi Monkeymomma  You are not alone... I’m also only 33 with 2 beautiful young children & have recently had a ‘scare’ - in fact still scared! I found a small lump 6 months ago which has grown into a large mass. When I finally found the courage to go to my Dr her demeanour also changed - dramatically. I’ve seen a Consultant now whom also can’t tell me what it is from just palpating so I am waiting on an Ultrasound & Biopsy. I pray yours is benign as I do mine. Keep us posted. You are not alone. X
Posts.Title: Looking for guidance and help Monkeymomma Monkeymomma

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2017 12:48PM - edited Nov 25, 2017 01:14PM by KSK Hi Monkeymomma  My lump is moveable but I can't define its edges & it's in the upper outter quadrant of my breast. It's texture isn't smooth, more rippled & firm. It feels (& is) attached to the back of my areola. It's approx 5cm so I'm told. I also have nipple / areola changes.  If working on the 2 second rule (my instinct) before my logical brain kicks in, I think it's not good news. However, logically & researching it could be a Fibroadenoma.  If you're in tune with your body, you could well be right but I do think it's natural for us to assume the worst due to self preservation. Please do keep us posted! I'm still waiting on an urgent ultrasound date
